subtopics.name: Informed Consent
subtopics.description: Ensuring that participants in research studies are fully aware of the nature of the study, its potential risks and benefits, and their rights as participants. This subtopic relates to Epistemology by addressing how knowledge is acquired ethically, and to Cognitive Science by understanding how participants process information about the study.

subtopics.name: Confidentiality and Data Protection
subtopics.description: Maintaining the privacy of research participants' data and ensuring that it is protected from unauthorized access. This subtopic is connected to Ontology as it deals with the existence and reality of personal information, and to Philosophy of Science as it involves ethical considerations in scientific inquiry.

subtopics.name: Avoidance of Harm
subtopics.description: Ensuring that research does not cause harm to participants or the environment. This subtopic integrates with Practical Wisdom by applying ethical principles in real-world contexts, and with Interdisciplinary Synthesis by considering the broader implications of research on society.

subtopics.name: Transparency and Accountability
subtopics.description: Ensuring that research methods, findings, and conclusions are transparent and that researchers are accountable for their actions. This subtopic aligns with Philosophy of Science by examining the foundations and methods of scientific inquiry, and with Interdisciplinary Synthesis by highlighting the interconnectedness of ethical considerations across different domains.

subtopics.name: Cultural Sensitivity
subtopics.description: Adapting research methods to respect cultural differences and avoid cultural insensitivity. This subtopic connects to Cognitive Science by understanding how cultural backgrounds influence perception and understanding, and to Ontology by recognizing the diversity of human existence.
